attributes.action: Reconsider how families are eligible for financial help towards childcare.
attributes.additional_details: household income needs to be looked at in more depth including incoming and out-coming, working families should not be worse off!
attributes.background:
21000 cut of point is not enough to decline someone for childcare funding. 
i have 3 children in nursery totalling £860 a month, i don't rely on benefits and i pay tax but i can't afford to live.
whilst people who are under 21000 receive childcare funding, housing & council tax benefit

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could ask for a specific change to the income level for eligibility for financial support for childcare.
